intro: Catha spathyphylla, commonly known as the African khat, is a flowering plant native to East Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits containing seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has significant cultural and historical importance in the regions where it is native.
